background_description: You strike from afar, but that does not make you a coward. You are a musician, the song of your bowstring nought but a warning, singing the silent promise of a quick death.

War.description: If you are first to attack, your bow gains the blast property for the first round.

Falconry.description: You keep a falcon [3 hp, 5 STR, 16 DEX, 4 WIL, claws (d6+d6), bite (d6)]. It only eats live game.

Hunting.description: When taking the Supply action your ability to secure Rations increases by one step (e.g. 1d4 becomes 1d6).

Tournaments.description: Attacks with your bow are enhanced if the target is immobile.

Training.description: If you are the first to attack, melee attacks against you are impaired until you take STR damage.

Scouting.description: When taking the Travel action, your presence decreases the chance of getting lost by one step (e.g. 4-in-6 becomes 3-in-6).

Western Yew.description: Can be wielded as a blunt weapon (d6). Noisy.

Sessile Oak.description: Slams into targets. On Critical Damage something is torn off.

Stone Pine.description: Produces one use of Sticky Sap per day. It is highly explosive.

White Ash.description: Can be used in place of a shield in melee combat.

Striped Bamboo.description: Collapsible, it only requires one slot (but still requires both hands).

Wych Elm.description: Protects the bearer from poisons and toxins, so long as they are holding it.

table2.question: What kind of wood is your bow made from?

options.description: Western Yew (d6, bulky). Can be wielded as a blunt weapon (d6). Noisy.
Sessile Oak (d8, bulky). Slams into targets. On Critical Damage something is torn off.
Stone Pine (d6, bulky). Produces one use of Sticky Sap per day. It is highly explosive.
White Ash (d6, bulky). Can be used in place of a shield in melee combat (+1 Armor).
Striped Bamboo (d6). Collapsible, it only requires one slot (but still requires both hands).
Wych Elm (d6, bulky). Protects the bearer from poisons and toxins, so long as they are holding it.
